medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ and epigastric pain with emesis
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 3am on the morning of admission after going to dinner at 11pm the previous night. The patient experienced cramping pain in the RUQ and epigastric region, with nausea leading to non-bilious, non-bloody emesis occurring 10 times. Pain improved at 7am after multiple episodes of emesis, and the patient went back to sleep. She then woke up at 11am and decided to go to the ED after consulting her sister. A similar episode occurred 3 weeks prior without vomiting that resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, HTN, GERD, Depression, Hypothyroidism, Headaches, Vertigo. Past surgical history includes back surgery; denies previous abdominal surgeries.
